Case.Bench: (Dr) Mukundakam Sharma and Anil R. Dave

CasesReferredTo.CaseReferred: Messrs Sharp Industries Limited v Commissioner of Central Excise, Mumbai-iii2005 (188) ELT 1462005 ILO SC 583

JudgmentText.P: The Order of the Court was as follows :
Heard learned counsel appearing for the appellant.

3. The respondent has not entered appearance despite service. The appellant has challenged the validity of the impugned judgment and order passed by the Tribunal on 5-7-2005 holding that the classification of plastic laminated aluminium foil should be made under the Heading 7607.60 and not under Heading 39.20 as claimed by the appellant. While rendering the aforesaid decision, the Tribunal relied upon a decision of this Court in 2003 (157) E.L.T. A35 wherein it was held thus:

I.P: "Since the revenue has accepted the judgment of the Customs, Excise and Gold (Control) Appellate Tribunal in Commissioner of Central Excise, Calcutta v. Indian Foil Ltd. - 2001 (132) E.L.T. 737 (Tri.) = 2000 (39) RLT 304 2000 ILO CEGAT 2387 and that the judgment has been followed in the case by Tribunal, the civil appeal is dismissed".

JudgmentText.P: 4. However, subsequent to the rendering of the aforesaid decision by this Court, the same issue came to be considered by this Court in another decision namely Sharp Industries Ltd. v. Commissioner of Central Excise, Mumbai-III reported in (2005) 7 SCC 676 = 2005 (188) E.L.T. 146 2005 ILO SC 583 (S.C.) wherein this court considered the issue and held that the product in question is classifiable under Tariff Heading 39.20 and not under 76.07. While rendering the aforesaid decision, the Division Bench has given detailed reasons as to why the said product should be classified under Tariff Heading 39.20.

B.P: Having gone through the said decision, we are of the considered opinion that the issue raised in the present case is covered by the decision of the Supreme Court in Sharp Industries Ltd. 2005 ILO SC 583 (supra).
6. In the light of the aforesaid decision, we hold that the product in question is classifiable under Heading 39.20. The appeal is allowed to the aforesaid extent.

EditorsNote.P: Excise - Indirect Tax - Central Excise Tariff Act, 1985, heading 7607.60 and 39.20 - Classification - Plastic laminated aluminium foil - Whether plastic laminated aluminium foil is classifiable under heading 7607.60 or under heading 39.20 of 1985 Tariff? - Held, SC in Sharp Industries Ltd. vs. Commissioner of Central Excise, Mumbai-III 2005 ILO SC 583, held that plastic laminated aluminium foil is classifiable under heading 39.20 of 1985 Tariff - Hence, impugned product classifiable under heading 39.20 of 1985 Tariff - Revenue's appeal allowed.
